area_name: Plate Rock aka South Sentry Boulder

content.description: On the South side of Plate rock, climb up flakes/jugs on the right side, to the right of the block on the ground.  I think to make this problem V2 the huge jug on the right is off limits.  Otherwise, if you use the mother of all jugs, the climbing seems to be V1.
content.protection: A crashpad is useful but not necessary.

content.description: Using very large and polished pebbles, move up the left side of the prominent southern face. The crux is the long-reach to the topout and hard-to-find holds.
content.location: It is the furthest route on the left side of the face, just before the arete. If you are approaching from the Falls Trail, this face points downhill and will be the 1st one you see on this rock.

content.description: Climb the triangle-plate feature on a lichen covered slab using the vertical pods. The crux is figuring out the sequence at the top.
content.protection: This is a tall problem with a flat ground landing. Several pads and one spotter are recommended.
content.location: It is on the West face of Plate Rock.

pathTokens: Denver Metropolitan Area Bouldering and Buildering
Plate Rock aka South Sentry Boulder
